item.title: Report X-2024040945
item.description:
Report X-2024040945

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-25T15:11:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-13
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 12th, during the PM sort a package was found leaking. The outside of the package was marked as UN3373 Biological Substance, Category B, 6.2 Further inspection of the package revealed that it contained blood plasma, and that is what leaked. The package was cleaned and placed into a steel salvage drum and retrieved by the shipper.

item.title: Report E-2024040512
item.description:
Report E-2024040512

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-25T15:11:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-10
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 10, 2024, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN1866 had faulty packaging and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. GES personnel utilized absorbent pads and neutralizer to remediate the impacted dock floor and tote exterior. GES tightened the lid of the 275-gallon tote and staged it onsite for further transport. All spent absorbents and impacted wooden slate were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon steel drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024040465
item.description:
Report E-2024040465

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-23T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-18
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a punctured 30-gallon metal drum containing CDR7102FCNA Hardner Type 02 damaged by a nail from a pallet. This resulted in an estimated 1-gallon release of product onto the wooden trailer floor in a 1’x1’ area. A Contractor cleaned-up the release with oil dry, overpacked the damaged drum, and containerized the pallet for waste disposal. One 85-gallon poly drum of waste was generated. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were affected by this incident.

item.title: Report X-2024040970
item.description:
Report X-2024040970

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-23T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-01
  • City: TUCSON
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found when unloading a trailer and QA quickly responded by placing the drum in a tote with gloves, absorbency pads and hazmat bags. DescribePack: The package failed due to pressure on the steel drum causing the fill hole to burst. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Station QA quickly responded and placed steel drum inside of a Hazmat bag and tote and used absorbency pads to clean up the spill.
